title: Device Powered Off
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
custom_steps: When the Chromecast device is powered off
custom_expected: Then the Cast icon will not be visible on the MLB app header

title: Device Powered On
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
custom_steps: When the Chromecast device is powered on
custom_expected:
Then the Cast icon will be visible in the MLB app header
and the icon will not be filled

title: Icon In-App
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
custom_steps: When the user browses through the app's different views
custom_expected: Then the Cast icon will be constantly visible in the app's header

title: WiFi Off
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
custom_steps: When the user turns the sender WiFi off
custom_expected: Then the cast icon will disappear soon after

title: WiFi On
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
custom_steps: When the user turns the sender Wifi back on
custom_expected: Then the cast icon will appear soon after

title: No Casting Device on Network
custom_preconds:
* User has latest version of app
* User does not have a casting device available on network
custom_steps: GIVEN there are no cast-able devices on the user's network
custom_expected:
THEN the Google cast button should not be visible

AND the audio ‘headphones’ should be in the far right on all bottom tab pages

title: Casting Device is Available on Network
custom_preconds:
* User has latest version of app
* User has casting device available on network
custom_steps: GIVEN there is a cast-able device on the user's network
custom_expected:
THEN the Google cast button should be visible

AND the audio ‘headphones’ should be to the right of the cast button on all bottom tab pages

title: Connected before starting video
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a cast receiver is available 
AND the user has connected to the Chromecast receiver via a button tap
custom_steps: WHEN a video is selected on the mobile device
custom_expected: THEN launch that video directly on the Chromecast receiver app

title: Start casting. after video has started
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a cast receiver is available 
AND the user has started playback on their mobile device 
AND Chromecast is enabled
custom_steps:
WHEN playback controls are displayed on the mobile device 
AND the user taps on the cast button
custom_expected:
THEN launch the existing video directly on the Chromecast receiver app 
AND dismiss existing video player from the mobile device

title: Casting icon displays- New Player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN the user has started video playback on their mobile device 
AND Chromecast is enabled
custom_steps: WHEN playback controls are displayed on the mobile device
custom_expected: THEN display the Chromecast button next to the feed picker button

title: Stop casting behaviors- New Player
custom_preconds: GIVEN a cast session is active

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user ends a cast session while video is still playing
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN restore that video back on the mobile app at the resume point

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user ends a cast session while video is no longer playing
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN do not restore video back on the mobile app

title: Tapping on Icon
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
custom_steps: When the user taps on the Cast icon
custom_expected:
Then the Cast menu opens
and the Chromecast's name will be listed in the menu

title: Selecting Available Device
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
custom_steps:
When the user opens the cast menu
and selects the available Chromecast device
custom_expected: Then waves in the lower left of the icon should animate while the connection is established

title: Icon when Connected
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
custom_steps:
When the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
and the user observes the cast icon on the sender
custom_expected:
Then the cast icon is visible
and will be filled in

title: Tapping on Filled Icon
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
custom_steps:
When the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
and the user taps on the filled cast icon
custom_expected:
THEN the cast menu will appear
AND the user will see the Chromecast name, a volume slider, and the "Stop Casting" button

title: Dismissing Cast Menu
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user taps on the cast icon
and then taps to "Cancel" the cast menu
custom_expected: Then the cast menu will be dismissed

title: Tapping VOD
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user taps to launch VOD content
(from Video Index, Team Page, etc)
custom_expected: THEN the loading spinner is displayed in expanded controls while the content loads on receiver

title: Sender App Expanded Controls for VOD
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is casting VOD content
and observes the iOS device's expanded controls
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see

Top Overlay: X button, Volume Slider (iPad only) cast icon (filled), Mute button
Thumbnail
Bottom Overlay: Play/Pause button, Duration bar, CC button

title: Sender App Mini Controller for VOD
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is casting VOD content
and taps the cast icon
and observes the iOS device's mini controller
custom_expected:
THEN the user sees the following:

Chromecast name
Cancel button
Thumbnail
Title
Play/Pause button
Volume Slider
Stop Casting button

title: Metadata on Receiver for VOD
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is casting VOD content 
and observes the receiver (TV)
custom_expected: Then the user will see the Headline, Duration, and Remaining Time & Total Time for the VOD

title: Tapping MLB.TV Live
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
AND the user is logged in with a TV-entitled account
custom_steps: When the user taps to launch a live MLB.TV feed
custom_expected: THEN the loading spinner is displayed in expanded controls while loading on receiver

title: Sender App Expanded Controls for MLB.TV Live
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
AND the user is logged in with a TV-entitled account
custom_steps:
When the user is casting a live MLB.TV feed
and observes the iOS device's expanded controls
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see

Top Overlay: Done button, Away Team @ Home Team, Volume Slider (iPad only) cast icon (filled), Mute button
Thumbnail of team logos (away team on left, home team on right)
Bottom Overlay: 30 seconds back, Play/Pause, 30 second forward, Ellapsed Time, Progress Bar, Live button, CC

title: Tapping MLB.TV Archive
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
AND the user is logged in with a TV-entitled account
custom_steps: When the user taps to launch an archived MLB.TV feed
custom_expected: THEN the loading spinner is displayed in expanded controls while loading on receiver

title: Sender App Expanded Controls for MLB.TV Archive
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
AND the user is logged in with a TV-entitled account
custom_steps:
When the user is casting an archived MLB.TV feed
and observes the iOS device's expanded controls
custom_expected:
THEN the user will see

Top Overlay: X button, Away Team @ Home Team, Volume Slider (iPad only) cast icon (filled), Mute button
Thumbnail of team logos (away team on left, home team on right)
Bottom Overlay: 30 seconds back, Play/Pause, 30 second forward, Ellapsed Time, Progress Bar, Remaining Time, CC

title: Sender App Mini Controller for MLB.TV
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
AND the user is logged in with a TV-entitled account
custom_steps:
When the user is casting an archived MLB.TV feed
and taps the Cast icon
and observes the iOS device's mini controller
custom_expected:
Then the user sees the following:

Chromecast name
Cancel button
Thumbnail of team logos (away team on left, home team on right)
Title
Play/Pause button
Volume Slider
Stop Casting button

title: Metadata on Receiver for MLB.TV
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
AND the user is logged in with a TV-entitled account
custom_steps:
When the user is casting a live MLB.TV feed
and observes the receiver (TV)
custom_expected: Then the user will see the Away Team @ Home Team, Game Date & Time, Venue, Remaining Time & Total Time

title: Sender App while Casting
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps: When the user views the sender app's expanded controls while casting
custom_expected:
THEN the Chromecast name appears in the expanded controls in the format:

"Casting to <Chromecast name>"

title: Pause Button (Expanded Controls)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is casting video content to the receiver
and taps the Pause button on the sender
custom_expected:
Then the content on the receiver will pause
and the user will see a pause icon on the receiver
and the Pause button on the sender will turn into a Play button

title: Mute Button (Expanded Controls)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is casting video content to the receiver
and taps the Mute button on the sender
custom_expected: Then the content on the receiver will mute

title: Mute Button - Un-mute (Expanded Controls)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is casting video content to the receiver
and the user has muted the video
and taps the Mute button on the sender to un-mute
custom_expected: Then the content on the receiver will un-mute

title: Closed Captioning Button (Expanded Controls)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is casting video content
and taps on the CC button in the sender's expanded controls to enable Closed Captioning
custom_expected:
Then Closed Captioning will be enabled
and will appear on the receiver

title: "X" Button (Expanded Controls)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is casting video content
and taps "X" from the sender's expanded controls
custom_expected:
THEN the user is returned to the app on the iOS device
AND the video is still being casted to the receiver

title: Pause Button (Mini Controller)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is casting video content to the receiver
and taps on the Cast Icon
and taps the Pause button on the sender's mini controller
custom_expected:
Then the content on the receiver will pause
and the user will see a pause icon on the receiver
and the Pause button on the sender will turn into a Play button

title: Volume Slider (Mini Controller)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is casting video content to the receiver
and taps on the Cast Icon
and swipes through the volume slider on the sender
custom_expected: Then the volume will adjust accordingly on the receiver

title: Volume (Hardware Buttons)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is casting video content to the receiver
and taps on the device's volume buttons
custom_expected: Then the volume will adjust accordingly on the receiver

title: "Stop Casting" (Mini Controller)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is casting video content
and taps on the Cast icon
and taps on "Stop Casting"
custom_expected:
THEN the VOD will stop casting
AND the receiver will display the Chromecast backdrop
AND local playback continues on the device

title: Thumbnail (Mini Controller)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is casting video content
and taps on the Cast icon
and taps on the video thumbnail
custom_expected: THEN the user will be taken to the expanded controls

title: Turning Off WiFi while Casting
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is casting video content
AND the user turns off the sender WiFi
custom_expected:
THEN the sender does not crash
AND cast icon is no longer filled
AND receiver continues playback uninterrupted

title: Turning WiFi Back On
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is casting video content
and had previously turned off Wifi on the sender app
and then turns Wifi back on
custom_expected:
THEN the app does not crash
and the cast reconnects on sender app
and the cast icon is filled
and video playback is uninterrupted

title: Killing App While Casting
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is casting video content
and kills the MLB app
custom_expected: Then casting should not be interrupted

title: Phone Calls While Casting
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is casting video content to the receiver
and the iOS device receives a phone call
custom_expected: Then the playback on the Chromecast will not be interrupted

title: Receiver in Idle State (few seconds)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is not casting any video content
and the receiver is in an idle state for a few seconds
custom_expected: THEN the user should see the idle screens rotate

title: Receiver in Idle State (> 5 minutes)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is not casting any video content
and the receiver is in an idle state for over 5 minutes
custom_expected:
THEN the receiver app tears down
and the sender app disconnects from the Chromecast  (icon is no longer filled)

title: Pause, and Wait 20 Minutes
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user has MLB app installed on an iOS device (sender)
AND connected to the same network as a Chromecast (receiver)
AND the Chromecast device has been selected from the cast menu
custom_steps:
When the user is casting video content
and taps to Pause the video
and waits 20 minutes
custom_expected:
THEN receiver app tears down (Chromecast displays Chromecast backdrop)
and sender app disconnects from Chromecast (cast icon no longer filled)
